# `shiny-app-setups`

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

`shiny-app-setups` contains setups for 1) R packages, 2) `golem` shiny apps, and 3) a `rhino` apps. 

All projects were created in the RStudio IDE (with the default options selected). 

## R App (as a package)

From the console, packages are built using `devtools` and `usethis`. 

The function for building a new package is `usethis::create_package()`

```{r create_package-myPkgApp, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("devtools")
library(devtools)
Loading required package: usethis
usethis::create_package(path = "myPkgApp")
```

When creating a new package in the IDE, I provide a name and the parent folder. New packages default to using `renv` and create a git repo. 

```{r rpkg-setup, out.width='70%', out.height='70%', echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics(path = "img/rpkg-setup.png")
```



## `golem` projects 

From the console, `golem` apps are also packages and are built using `golem::create_golem()`:

```{r create_golem-myGolemApp, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("golem")
library(golem)
golem::create_golem(path = "myGolemApp")
```


```{r golem-setup, out.width='70%', out.height='70%', echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics(path = "img/golem-setup.png")
```

## `rhino` projects

From the console, `rhino` apps not packages (they use [`box`](https://klmr.me/box/)), and are built using `rhino::init()`:

```{r init-myRhinoApp, eval=FALSE}
install.packages("rhino")
library(rhino)
rhino::init(dir = "myRhinoApp")
```


```{r rhino-setup, out.width='70%', out.height='70%', echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics(path = "img/rhino-setup.png")
```
